p:
Using fitted parameters for
β
and
ε
, we additionally calculated R 0, the basic reproduction number for the virus, for each cell line-virus-MOI combination ( Table 1; Supplementary file 4). We found that R 0 was essentially unchanged across differing immune assumptions for RoNi/7.1 and Vero cells, for which the initial antiviral rate was low. In the case of PaKiT01 cells, a high initial antiviral rate under either induced or constitutive immunity resulted in a correspondingly high estimation of
β
(and, consequently,
R
0
) which still produced the same epidemic curve that resulted from the much lower estimates for
β
and R 0 paired with absent immunity. These findings suggest that antiviral immune responses protect host tissues against virus-induced cell mortality and may facilitate the establishment of more rapid within-host transmission rates.
